born 13 September, 1972
nationality: Russian
married with three children and one dog

Fields of study

linguistic typology, sociolinguistics, language documentation, and corpus linguistics; in particular:

  • morphology and morphosyntax
  • nominal categories
  • language variation
  • language contact
  • corpus linguistics

Empirical expertise

  • East Caucasian (Nakh-Daghestanian) languages
  • languages of Russia
  • Russian

Michael Daniel

University of Jena, research fellow (DFG Eigene Stelle)
0000-0002-2091-5713
misha.daniel@gmail.com

Invited lectures

University of Helsinki (2009), University of Trømsø (2009), MPI Leipzig (2010), University of Regensburg (2012), University of Milwaukee (2015), University of Almaty (2016), University of Düsseldorf (2016, 2018), University of Pavia (2016, 2017), University of Stockholm (2017), University of Lyon (2017), Nazarbaev University in Astana (2019), University of Batumi (2019), New York University (2019), University of Pavia (2019), University of New Mexico (2019, online), Online Course on East Caucasian Linguistics, second series (one lecture, 2020), University of Hamburg (2021, online), University of Frankfurt (2021, online), University of Pavia (2021), Online Course on East Caucasian Linguistics (2020, 2021), Linguistic diversity, multilingualism and marriage patterns in highland Daghestan (a mini-course of four lectures at the University of Hamburg together with Nina Dobrushina, 2022), University of Kiel (2022), University of Tübingen (2023), UPV/EHU (Vitoria) (2023), Centre de Recherche en Linguistique Appliquée (CeRLA, Lyon 2, 2024), Hong Kong University (2024), University of Pavia (2024), University of Halle (2024), .

Conference organization

2024 Сonvenor of the ALT 2024 workshop Valency and valency alternations within and across language boundaries (together with Silvia Luraghi, Chiara Zanchi and Guglielmo Inglese), Singapore 2024.
2024 Сonvenor of the SLE 2024 workshop Mass nouns in a typological perspective (together with Silva Nurmio and Yvonne Treis), Helsinki 2024.
2024 Сonvenor of the SLE 2022 workshop Spatial and social separation of speech communities and language change (together with Ezekiel Koile, Pierpaolo Di Carlo, Jeff Good and Susanna Michaelis), Bucharest 2022.
2024 Сonvenor of the SWL IV workshop Reported speech in East Caucasian (together with Timur Maisak), Lyon 2010.
2024 Convenor of the workshop Non-spatial functions of spatial forms in East Caucasian (together with Dmitry Ganenkov), Case in and Across Languages, Helsinki, August 2009.

Talks and presentations (after 2018)

2025 Daniel, Michael, and Timofey Mukhin. 2025. Elevational deixis in narrative: data from East Caucasian. SWL X, Potsdam, September, 8-10.

Linguistic distances between dialects are indicative of the history of resettling. 58th Annual meeting of the Societas Linguistica Europaea, Bordeaux, France, August, 26-29.
